Class Summary
WTLS20Connection Represents a WTLS 2.0 Connection.
WTLSCipherSuites This class contains the necessary information for a developer or a user or an interested IT person to determine and specify the ciphersuites that are to be used with a specific connection or that are supposed to be used in general with all connections.
 

Package net.rim.device.api.crypto.tls.wtls20 Description

WTLS 2.0 Classes and Definitions

Wireless Transport Layer Security (WTLS) is the security layer of the WAP, providing confidentiality, data integrity and authentication for WAP services. It allows the client and server to achieve authenticated communication in order for wireless transactions to remain secure.

The implementation of WTLS 2.0 that we provide is defined in WAP-199-WTLS from Feb. 2000 and WAP-261-WTLS-20010406-a from April 2001.

WTLS is based on the TLS v1.0 security layer. This packages contains RIM's implementation of WTLS.
